alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; East Valley; Northwest Pinal County; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Superior; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 5:58PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 645 PM MST... At 557 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Sun Lakes to near Coolidge. Additional storms were near Stanfield. Movement was east at 30 mph. Additional thunderstorms may develop within the advised area. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Casa Grande, Florence, Coolidge, Sun Lakes, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Arizona City, La Palma, San Tan Village Mall, San Tan Valley, Seville, Florence Junction, Bapchule, Olberg, Arizola, Phoenix Mesa Gateway Airport and San Tan Mountain Park. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 162 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 144 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 209 and 217. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; East Valley; Northwest Pinal County; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Superior; West Pinal County
